thread.title: Syria Democratic Forces enter Deir al-Zor province for first time - Kurdish military source | Reuters
thread.title_full: Syria Democratic Forces enter Deir al-Zor province for first time - Kurdish military source | Reuters

title: Syria Democratic Forces enter Deir al-Zor province for first time - Kurdish military source | Reuters
text:
World News | Tue Feb 21, 2017 | 6:16pm GMT Syria Democratic Forces enter Deir al-Zor province for first time - Kurdish military source left right Syrian Democratic Forces (SDF) stand on their military vehicle in northern Deir al-Zor province ahead of an offensive against Islamic State militants, Syria February 21, 2017. REUTERS/Rodi Said 1/6 left right A Syrian Democratic Forces (SDF) female fighter adjusts a mortar in northern Deir al-Zor province ahead of an offensive against Islamic State militants, Syria February 21, 2017. REUTERS/Rodi Said 2/6 left right A drone is pictured as a Syrian Democratic Forces (SDF) fighter gets into a military vehicle in northern Deir al-Zor province ahead of an offensive against Islamic State militants, Syria February 21, 2017. REUTERS/Rodi Said 3/6 left right A Syrian Democratic Forces (SDF) fighter sits in front of a damaged tower ahead of an offensive against Islamic State militants in northern Deir al-Zor province, Syria February 21, 2017. REUTERS/Rodi Said 4/6 left right Syrian Democratic Forces (SDF) female fighters walk with their weapons in northern Deir al-Zor province ahead of an offensive against Islamic State militants, Syria February 21, 2017. REUTERS/Rodi Said 5/6 left right Syrian Democratic Forces (SDF) gather in northern Deir al-Zor province ahead of an offensive against Islamic State militants, Syria February 21, 2017. REUTERS/Rodi Said 6/6 
BEIRUT The U.S.-backed Syria Democratic Forces alliance has crossed into Deir al-Zor province for the first time, as part of a U.S.-backed offensive against Islamic State, a Kurdish military source said on Tuesday. 
The advance is part of an operation to encircle and ultimately capture the ultra-hardline group's de facto Syrian capital of Raqqa in the north of the country. 
The SDF, which consists of Kurdish and Arab fighters, had entered the northern part of Deir al-Zor province and captured a number of villages from Islamic State militants, the Kurdish military source told Reuters. 
(Reporting by Tom Perry, writing by John Davison; editing by Ralph Boulton) Next In World News
